intro: Hymenoxys hoopesii, commonly known as the Hoopes' pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple or brown center, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hymenoxys hoopesii is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun.
